uk.gov.gchq.palisade.cache.service.impl

Interface BackingStore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EtcdBackingStore, HashMapBackingStore, PropertiesBackingStore

    public interface BackingStore
    This class defines the basic operations that any backing store to the cache service must define. This allows for many different database or persistence mechanisms to be used as stores for Palisades. This interface should be deliberately kept as minimal and simple as possible. Persistence mechanisms must be able to support a "time to live" facility on cache entries; it is assumed that after the specified time to live has expired the associated data will be automatically removed from the backing store and subsequent attempts to get that entry will fail.
    API Note:
    All methods on this class are assumed to throw NullPointerException if any method parameters are null.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(String key,
            Class<?> valueClass,
            byte[] value,
            Optional<Duration> timeToLive)
        Store the given data in the backing store. The byte array value is assumed to encode an object of the type represented by the class valueClass. The key must not be empty or null. If a time to live duration is required on this entry, then the optional specified should not be empty. Durations must not be negative.

        It is the responsibility of the backing store to ensure that the valueClass is stored along with the object byte array. The standard way to do this is to store the type name of the class. See Class.getTypeName().

        Parameters:
        key - the cache key
        valueClass - the object type represented in the byte array
        value - the encoded object
        timeToLive - an optional time to live, maybe be empty
        Returns:
        true if and only if the the cache entry was made successfully
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is negative
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is empty (once whitespace is trimmed)

      • add

        default boolean add(String key,
                    Class<?> valueClass,
                    byte[] value)
        Store the given data with infinite time to live. This a convenience method that simply calls add(String, Class, byte[], Optional) with an empty duration.
        Parameters:
        key - the cache key
        valueClass - the object type represented in the byte array
        value - the encoded object
        Returns:
        true if and only if the cache entry was made successfully
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is empty (once whitespace is trimmed)
        See Also:
        add(String, Class, byte[], Optional)

      • get

        SimpleCacheObject get(String key)
        Attempt to get the given key from the backing store. Looks up the given key and attempts to get it. If the requested key couldn't be found then the value of the returned SimpleCacheObject will be empty. A new cache object should be returned for each call to this method. If the key can't be found, then the expected class should be Object.class inside the returned object.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to lookup
        Returns:
        a new cache object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is empty (once whitespace is trimmed)

      • list

        Stream<String> list(String prefix)
        Get a stream of all keys with a given prefix. This method acts as a way to query the backing store to find which keys it has. The returned list will have all the keys that start with the given string in it.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to look for
        Returns:
        a stream of valid keys

      • keyCheck

        static String keyCheck(String key)
        Check the provided key is not empty.
        Parameters:
        key - the backing store key
        Returns:
        the key
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given key is null once whitespace is trimmed

      • durationCheck

        static void durationCheck(Optional<Duration> duration)
        Check the provided duration. If the duration is null or negative an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        duration - duration to check
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if duration is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is negative

      • validateAddParameters

        static String validateAddParameters(String key,
                                    Class<?> valueClass,
                                    byte[] value,
                                    Optional<Duration> timeToLive)
        Convenience method to validate the parameters to an add call.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to add
        valueClass - the type of the value
        value - the encoded value
        timeToLive - optional time to live
        Returns:
        the key
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if anything is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is negative, or the trimmed key is empty
        See Also:
        durationCheck(Optional), keyCheck(String)
